data.title: Inverted
data.statement:
Your task is to invert a given text [[t]]. For characters the alphabet is turned around like this:

a = z
b = y
c = x
...
x = c
y = b
z = a

<<Cases of letters are not affected in the inversion: A = Z, B = Y ...>>


Numbers are changed like this:

0 = 9
1 = 8
...
8 = 1
9 = 0

Brackets ((), [], {}) are turned around like this:

[ = ]
( = )
{ = }
] = [
) = (
} = {

Spaces and punctuation are not changed.

testCases.title: Upper- and lowercase
testCases.testIn: Did you pay attention on UPPER and LOWERcase
testCases.testOut: Wrw blf kzb zggvmgrlm lm FKKVI zmw OLDVIxzhv

testCases.title: Numbers
testCases.testIn: I hope, your program succeeded in Testcase 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5. Then you will probably get 100%.
testCases.testOut: R slkv, blfi kiltizn hfxxvvwvw rm Gvhgxzhv 8, 7, 6, 5 zmw 4. Gsvm blf droo kilyzyob tvg 899%.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn: But if your program didn't pass Validator 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5, you won't get 100%.
testCases.testOut: Yfg ru blfi kiltizn wrwm'g kzhh Ezorwzgli 8, 7, 6, 5 zmw 4, blf dlm'g tvg 899%.

testCases.title: Brackets
testCases.testIn: This is a Testcase to find out, if your program turns brackets (like (, ), [, ], { and }) around.
testCases.testOut: Gsrh rh z Gvhgxzhv gl urmw lfg, ru blfi kiltizn gfimh yizxpvgh )orpv ), (, ], [, } zmw {( zilfmw.

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testIn: This is the Validator which checks if your program also checks for brackets (to example [, ], (, ), { or }).
testCases.testOut: Gsrh rh gsv Ezorwzgli dsrxs xsvxph ru blfi kiltizn zohl xsvxph uli yizxpvgh )gl vcznkov ], [, ), (, } li {(.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your task is to invert a given text t. For characters the alphabet is turned around like this:

a = z
b = y
c = x
...
x = c
y = b
z = a

Cases of letters are not affected in the inversion: A = Z, B = Y ...


Numbers are changed like this:

0 = 9
1 = 8
...
8 = 1
9 = 0

Brackets ((), [], {}) are turned around like this:

[ = ]
( = )
{ = }
] = [
) = (
} = {

Spaces and punctuation are not changed.
Input
Line 1: The text t.
Output
Line 1: The inverted text t
Constraints
1 ≤ Length of t ≤ 150
Example
Input
ab
Output
zy
